intro: Allium willeanum, commonly known as the Willean onion, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous base and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its botanical features make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to gardens.
